= Chronoscope GSS Reference === Elements ==|| Element || Description || Child Elements || Properties || Sample ||||  ====series====  || for each time series, there is a series element with class s#, for example, the first time series dataset is represented by series.s0, and the second by series.s1 ||  || 
  * [#group group] 
  * [#color color] 
  * [#background-color background-color] 
  * [#background-image background-image] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{series.s1 line { color: green } /* Make the second times series line green */ }}}  ||||  ====marker====  || A marker that represents a single point on the curve. || 
  * [#domainmarker domainmarker]  || 
  * [#opacity opacity] 
  * [#background-color background-color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{marker { background-color: green; opacity: 0.3 } /* Make the marker green and 70% transparent */ }}}  ||||  ====crosshair====  || Visibility of crosshair ||  || 
  * [#number-format number-format] 
  * [#date-format date-format] 
  * [#point-selection point-selection] 
  * [#line-thickness line-thickness] 
  * [#color color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{crosshair { visibility: visible; line-thickness: 2px; color: red} /* draws a red line 2 pixels thick */ }}}  ||||  ====domainmarker====  || A highlighting marker that stretches along the X axis. || 
  * [#domainmarker domainmarker]  || 
  * [#opacity opacity] 
  * [#background-color background-color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{domainmarker { background-color: green; opacity: 0.3 } /* Make the highlight green and 70% transparent */ }}}  ||||  ====labels====  || Controls visible of legend labelsc. ||  || 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{axislegend labels { visibility: hidden } }}}  ||||  ====fill====  || Allows styling of horizontal and vertical grid lines. ||  || 
  * [#opacity opacity] 
  * [#point-selection point-selection] 
  * [#line-thickness line-thickness] 
  * [#color color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{axis.domain grid { opacity: 0.5; visiblity: visible; } }}}  ||||  ====guideline====  || Guidelines on markers || 
  * [#marker marker]  || 
  * [#point-selection point-selection] 
  * [#line-thickness line-thickness] 
  * [#color color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{marker.foo guideline { visibility: visible; line-thickness: 2px; color: red} /* draws a red line 2 pixels thick */ }}}  ||||  ====line====  || Controls styles used for line rendering || 
  * [#fill fill]  || 
  * [#line-thickness line-thickness] {{{line { line-thickness: 2px; color: red} /* draws a red line 2 pixels thick */ }}}  ||||  ====grid====  || In a line plot, allows control of fill region beneath line. ||  || 
  * [#opacity opacity] 
  * [#background-color background-color] 
  * [#background-image background-image] {{{line fill { opacity: 0.5; background-color: lightblue; } /* draws a filled region below plotted line 50% transparent and light blue */ }}}  ||||  ====axislegend====  || Legend ||  || 
  * [#background-color background-color] 
  * [#color color] 
  * [#visibility visibility] {{{axislegend { visibility: hidden } }}}  ||== Properties ==|| Property Name || Description || Units ||=== Units ===|| Unit Type || Description |||| ==== INTEGER ==== || An integer value. || || ==== PX ==== || An integer value in pixel units, with optional px suffix || || ==== FLOAT ==== || A floating point value || || ==== PT ==== || A font point size, a number followed by the suffix 'pt' || || ==== URI ==== || A URL of the format url(http://host.domain/some/path) || || ==== COLOR ==== || A CSS color name, rgb triple rgb(r,g,b), hexadecimal triple (e.g. #f0a2c9), an rgba quadruple rgba(r,g,b,a). Note:  Shorthand colors such as #fff; will work in most browsers but fail in IE. || || ==== BGIMAGE ==== || A url to an image to be placed in the background of the form url(http://host.domain/some/image.png) or a gradient function gradient(startx, starty, endx, endy, colorstop, color, colorstop, color, ...) || || ==== STRING ==== || A string with or without surrounding quotes. ||
